page.title: 11FARMING IN THE COTSWOLDS
page.content: {Symonds Hall Farm,}owned by Mr and Mrs Grey, has a herd of one hundred and forty dairy cows and a few beef cattle. They also have some sheep and chickens. Fifty of their seventy acres are used to grow the following crops: potatoes, cabbages and corn. The fields are divided by hedgerows which the owners have preserved. Farm buildings include seven barns. {Upper Rushmire Farm,}owned by Mr and Mrs Noels covers twenty two acres of land. They have one hundred and ten animals which include cattle, goats and sheep, they also keep bees and have an orchard of pear trees. The farm has seven barns and a cotswold stone farm house. The owners prefer to have big fields and have cut down some of their hedges. During three years of ownership the Noels have not been bothered by poachers.
